title: Fuel Tank - Installation

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
The fuel hose must be routed with no kinks or twists to allow unrestricted fuel flow to the fuel rail.
Failure to route the fuel hose correctly may cause fuel starvation in certain conditions.
Fuel starvation causes the engine to lose power leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
If removed, refit the front fuel tank bracket to the fuel tank and tighten the fixings to
With the aid of an assistant. align the fuel tank above its mountings to connect the fuel hoses and electrical connectors.
Position the evaporative hose and the fuel tank overflow hose below the fuel hose.

Position the fuel hose so that the curve follows the route adjacent to the left hand side of the frame and the orange fuel hose connector locates to the right hand side of the frame with no kinks or twists, as shown in the diagram below.
Position the fuel pump electrical connector and the fuel level sensor harness above the fuel hose.
The fuel hose has different coloured connectors on each end, to aid orientation. The orange end must be fitted to the fuel tank, the grey end must be fitted to the fuel rails.
Reconnect the fuel pump electrical connector (brown).
Reconnect the fuel level sensor electrical connector (black).
Reconnect the fuel feed hose (orange connector) by gently pushing inwards until the hose engages with a click.

Slide the double check latch down (towards the spigot) until the release buttons are covered. If the latch will not slide into position, then the fuel hose is not fitted correctly on its spigot and must therefore be refitted correctly.
Connect the fuel tank overflow hose
Fuel tank overflow hose (6 mm diameter)
Make sure the fuel hose is not trapped between the fuel tank seam and rear sub frame.
A damaged fuel hose may cause reduced fuel pressure or a fuel leak.
Trapped fuel hoses may cause the hose to split , causing a fire and personal injury and damage to property
Make sure the evaporative hose is not trapped when lowering the fuel tank..
A damaged evaporative hose may cause the evaporative system to become blocked.
Damaged or trapped hoses may cause the engine to lose power leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Position the fuel hose so that it is clear of the fuel tank seam, left hand frame and it's fixings and it doesn't interfere with the routing of the evaporative hose.
Lower the fuel tank onto its mountings.
Refit the rear spacer sleeve. Fit the rear bolt but do not fully tighten at this stage.
Tighten the fuel tank rear mounting bolt to
Refit the two bolts for the fuel tank front mounting to the frame and tighten to
Observe the warning advice given in the General Information section on the safe handling of fuel and fuel containers.
A fire, causing personal injury and damage to property could result from spilled fuel or fuel not handled or stored correctly.
Using proprietary professional automotive workshop equipment approved for fuel handling, refill the fuel tank with the fuel previously removed.
Reconnect the battery, positive (red) lead first. Tighten the battery terminals to
Start the engine and check carefully for fuel leaks. Rectify as necessary.

Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
The fuel hose must be routed with no kinks or twists to allow unrestricted fuel flow to the fuel rail.
Failure to route the fuel hose correctly may cause fuel starvation in certain conditions.
Fuel starvation causes the engine to lose power leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
If removed, refit the front fuel tank bracket to the fuel tank and tighten the fixings to
9 Nm
With the aid of an assistant. align the fuel tank above its mountings to connect the fuel hoses and electrical connectors.
Position the evaporative hose and the fuel tank overflow hose below the fuel hose.

Position the fuel hose so that the curve follows the route adjacent to the left hand side of the frame and the orange fuel hose connector locates to the right hand side of the frame with no kinks or twists, as shown in the diagram below.
Position the fuel pump electrical connector and the fuel level sensor harness above the fuel hose.
Fuel hose

Harness
Fuel level sensor connector (black)
Fuel pump electrical connector (brown)
Evaporative hose (from canister)
Fuel tank overflow hose
The fuel hose has different coloured connectors on each end, to aid orientation. The orange end must be fitted to the fuel tank, the grey end must be fitted to the fuel rails.
Reconnect the fuel pump electrical connector (brown).
Reconnect the fuel level sensor electrical connector (black).
Reconnect the fuel feed hose (orange connector) by gently pushing inwards until the hose engages with a click.

Slide the double check latch down (towards the spigot) until the release buttons are covered. If the latch will not slide into position, then the fuel hose is not fitted correctly on its spigot and must therefore be refitted correctly.
Connect the fuel tank overflow hose
Connect the evaporative hose.
Fuel hose connector (orange)
Fuel pump electrical connector (brown)
Fuel level sensor electrical connector (black)
Fuel tank overflow hose (6 mm diameter)
Evaporative hose (8 mm diameter)
Make sure the fuel hose is not trapped between the fuel tank seam and rear sub frame.
A damaged fuel hose may cause reduced fuel pressure or a fuel leak.
Trapped fuel hoses may cause the hose to split , causing a fire and personal injury and damage to property
Make sure the evaporative hose is not trapped when lowering the fuel tank..
A damaged evaporative hose may cause the evaporative system to become blocked.
Damaged or trapped hoses may cause the engine to lose power leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Position the fuel hose so that it is clear of the fuel tank seam, left hand frame and it's fixings and it doesn't interfere with the routing of the evaporative hose.
Lower the fuel tank onto its mountings.
Refit the rear spacer sleeve. Fit the rear bolt but do not fully tighten at this stage.
Tighten the fuel tank rear mounting bolt to
8 Nm
Refit the two bolts for the fuel tank front mounting to the frame and tighten to
9 Nm
Observe the warning advice given in the General Information section on the safe handling of fuel and fuel containers.
A fire, causing personal injury and damage to property could result from spilled fuel or fuel not handled or stored correctly.
Using proprietary professional automotive workshop equipment approved for fuel handling, refill the fuel tank with the fuel previously removed.
Reconnect the battery, positive (red) lead first. Tighten the battery terminals to
4.5 Nm
Start the engine and check carefully for fuel leaks. Rectify as necessary.
